CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 24, 1961, pg. 17 reads: "Open Air Gospel - This is a familiar scene to the scores of listeners, who are gathering at the corner of Centre Ave. and Crawford St., each Friday at 8p.m., to hear the gospel, as it is preached by Father John LaBauve of Louisiana, holding the microphone. Father Paul Basompierre, right, is priest administrator of St. Brigid's Church. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Father John LaBauve, holding microphone stand, and Father Paul Basompierre, standing on truck bed preaching to group of men and women on the corner of Centre Avenue and Crawford Street, with Frenchie's Fine Foods and Sebastian D' Epiro Alderman in background
